title: Kim Kardashian is chill in Hollywood after Kanye's anti-abortion rant
text:
Kim Kardashian and Scott Disick looked relaxed on their outing in West Hollywood fresh from Kanye West’s claims that democrats ‘brainwashed’ black Americans and made them ‘abort children’.

The Keeping Up With The Kardashians star seems to have put her husband’s controversial opinion behind her as she stepped out to film for the show at the Groundlings Theatre.

The mum-of-four rocked a pair of PVC trousers with a simple white t-shirt as she made her way into the building.

Scott was also spotted arriving at the same place but with a more casual look.

The star – who is dating 21-year-old Sofia Richie – wore jeans and a sweatshirt while hanging out with his former in-laws.

While Kim is busy completing her many projects, it looks like she doesn’t have time to listen to Kanye’s religious rants.

Kanye recently came out against abortion and birth control in a controversial new interview, stating ‘Thou shall not kill’.

Scott was previously with Kourtney Kardashian (Picture: JACK / BACKGRID)

Can she breathe in those PVCs? (Picture: Backgrid)

Kim’s husband had a chat with Big Boy over the weekend, in a bid to promote new album Jesus Is King.

Advertisement

Advertisement

And the 42-year-old took a huge swipe at the Democratic party, claiming they ‘brainwashed’ black Americans, making them ‘abort their children’.

‘We’re [black Americans] brainwashed out here, bro. Come on, man. This is a free man talking,’ he told the host. ‘Democrats had us voting Democrats with food stamps for years. What are you talking about? Guns in the Eighties, taking the fathers out the home, Plan B, lowering our votes, making us abort our children…

‘Thou shall not kill.

‘I can’t tell y’all how to feel, but I can tell you honestly [this] is how I feel.’

We personally never thought we’d hear the words Kanye, abortion, and food stamps in the same sentence but here we are.

And Yeezy has absolutely no fears about being ‘cancelled’ for his comments, as he only fears God.

Kanye doesn’t care if he gets cancelled (Picture: SAUL LOEB/AFP/Getty Images)

The Gold Digger rapper continued: ‘I fear and love God. When you remove the fear and love of God, you create the fear and love of everything else. You’re talking to someone right now who only fears God.

‘I’m only afraid of my daddy, God. I done been 15 years.

‘I’m telling you that God is showing you that you can have your own thoughts, bro. I been cancelled before there was cancel culture. Who told you that my career would be over?’

Kanye also took aim at those who suggested he shouldn’t be voting for President Donald Trump based on the colour of his skin.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘The most racist thing a person can tell me is that I’m supposed to choose something based on my race,’ the dad-of-four added.

‘If that was the case, I would’ve never worn a pink polo, I would never have worn skinny jeans.’

description: Kim Kardashian was spotted filming in West Hollywood after husband Kanye West revealed he is anti-abortion and anti birth control.
